intro: Mendoncia smithii, commonly known as the Smith's mendoncia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
